sen.j: 白河天皇が南都御幸の際にその眉目秀麗なるを見初め、寵童（男色相手）として召し出したという。
sen.e: When the Emperor Shirakawa made imperial visit to Nanto (Nara), he noticed that Imainumaru was handsome and took the boy enlisted into the Emperor's service as a chodo (sodomy partner).

sen.j: 北面の武士としては寛治2年（1088年）『白河上皇高野御幸記』にその名が見え、『中右記』では康和4年（1102年）4月25日以降検非違使在職が確認できる。
sen.e: His name as a Hokumen no Bushi (Imperial Guards) can be seen in "Shirakawa Joko Koya gokoki" (the Retired Emperor Shirakawa's visit to Mount Koya) in 1088 and, in "Chuyuki" (diary of FUJIWARA no Munetada), we can confirm that he was in the position of Kebiishi since April 25, 1102.

sen.j: 嘉承3年(1108年)には、藤原佐実が源中正との乱闘の末に髻を切られるという事件に際し、白河院の意を受けた摂政藤原忠実の命により、犯人を逮捕して名を挙げた。
sen.e: In 1108, when FUJIWARA no Sukezane (藤原佐実) [読み不明] had his topknot cut in the free-for-all with MINAMOTO no Nakamasa, he became famous by arresting the offender in accordance with the order of FUJIWARA no Tadazane, who was Sessho, based on Shirakawa-in's will.

sen.j: 永久 (元号)元年(1113年)、いわゆる「永久の強訴」に当たっては、平正盛、平忠盛、源為義、源光国らとともに興福寺大衆の鎮圧に派遣され、また同年、鳥羽天皇呪詛の罪状を得た醍醐寺の僧仁寛の逮捕にも当たっている。
sen.e: In 1113, on the occasion of so-called "Eikyu no goso" (direct petition in Eikyu era), together with TAIRA no Masamori, TAIRA no Tadamori, MINAMOTO no Tameyoshi, and MINAMOTO no Mitsukuni, he was dispatched to suppress priests of the Kofuku-ji Temple and, in the same year, he arrested Ninkan, who was a priest of the Daigo-ji Temple and accused of curse against the Emperor Toba.
